From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia




2021 Indian filmTime to DanceTheatrical release posterDirected byStanley D'CostaWritten byDeepak DwivediProduced byLizelle D'SouzaStarringSooraj Pancholi Isabelle Kaif Waluscha De SousaCinematographyRajeev ShrivastavaEdited byMunishwer Bharat Singh RaoMusic byVijay VermaAnamik ChauhanLytonProductioncompanyT Films UK Limited ProductionDistributed byAA FilmsRelease date
12 March 2021 (2021-03-12)[1]
Running time113 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Time to Dance is a 2021 Indian dance film directed by Stanley D'Costa. Produced by Lizelle D'Souza it features Sooraj Pancholi, Isabelle Kaif and Waluscha De Sousa in the lead roles.[2][3] The film was theatrically released in India on 12 March 2021.[1]


Synopsis[edit]
An injured ballroom dancer gets her hopes up when she meets the perfect dance partner. Overcoming her painful past, she strives to succeed without losing her heart to her new teammate.

Cast[edit]
Sooraj Pancholi as Rishabh
Isabelle Kaif as Isha
Waluscha De Sousa as Meher
Saqib Saleem as Navdeep Singh
Rajpal Yadav as Sada
Natasha Powell as William' mother
Guru Randhawa as himself in the song Munde Mar Gaye (special appearance)
Martin Rycroft as William
Production[edit]
Development[edit]
Stanley D'Costa's directional debut portrays Sooraj Pancholi as a street dancer and Isabelle Kaif as a ballroom Latin dancer. The training for the  Latin ballroom dances for  the lead actors  is  done by Sneh Vadhani.

Filming[edit]
Film's pre-production began in March 2018,[4] and principal photography commenced at London in June 2018.[5][6][7]

Soundtrack[edit]
Time to DanceSoundtrack album by Rochak Kohli,  Vishal Mishra, Guru Randhawa — Vee, Gurinder Seagal and Vijay VermaReleased20 March 2021 (2021-03-20)[8]GenreFeature film soundtrackLength34:50LanguageHindiLabelT-SeriesOfficial audioTime To Dance - Full Album on YouTube

The film's music was composed by Rochak Kohli, Vishal Mishra, Guru Randhawa — Vee,  Gurinder Seagal and Vijay Verma while the lyrics were written by Kumaar, Kunaal Vermaa, Guru Randhawa, Geet Sagar, Rajesh Manthan, Neha Karode and Amrita Talukder.

^ a b "'Time To Dance': The Sooraj Pancholi and Isabelle Kaif starrer to release on March 12, 2021". The Times of India. 22 February 2021. Archived from the original on 13 July 2021. Retrieved 24 February 2021.

^ "'Time To Dance': Katrina Kaif's sister Isabelle Kaif, Sooraj Pancholi's film to go on floors in London". DNA. 29 March 2018. Archived from the original on 27 March 2019. Retrieved 25 March 2019.

^ "Waluscha "De Souza talks about working with Sooraj Pancholi, Isabelle Kaif in Time To Dance". Mumbai Mirror. 22 May 2018. Retrieved 26 February 2021.[permanent dead link]

^ "Kaif's sister Isabelle is all set to debut with Sooraj Pancholi in Time To Dance. See her pic". Hindustan Times. 30 May 2018. Archived from the original on 26 February 2021. Retrieved 26 February 2021.

^ "Sooraj "Pancholi's picture from the sets of 'Time To Dance' proves he doesn't get Isabelle Kaif's sense of humor". The Times of India. 13 June 2018. Retrieved 26 February 2021.

^ "This picture of Isabelle Kaif and Sooraj Pancholi sharing a hearty laugh on the sets of Time To Dance is a GLIMPSE of their adorable chemistry!". Bollywood Hungama. 15 June 2018. Archived from the original on 22 September 2020. Retrieved 26 February 2021.

^ "Waluscha De Sousa begins shooting for Remo D'Souza's Time To Dance". Daily News & Analysis. 25 June 2018. Archived from the original on 16 July 2023. Retrieved 26 February 2021.

^ "Time to Dance  – Original Motion Picture Soundtrack". Jiosaavn. 20 March 2021. Archived from the original on 18 April 2021. Retrieved 23 March 2021.
